definition: to roam around/to have a stroll

sentences.english: Give them a call and hang out sometime.
sentences.chinese: 给他们打个电话，约个时间出去逛逛吧。

sentences.english: Have a little this several days depressed, very stuffy, so absolutely go out to take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 这几天有点郁闷，闷得发慌，所以绝对出去逛逛。

sentences.english: Just browsing. Mabe later I might need your help.
sentences.chinese: 我只是逛逛，或许待会需要你的帮忙。

sentences.english: that's a great thing to do especially when it's nice like this.
sentences.chinese: 当那里景色美丽的时候，去逛逛是很棒的一件事。

sentences.english: No, I want to walk around. Let's go to the food court.
sentences.chinese: 不，我想四处逛逛，我们去美食街吧。

sentences.english: Why not go to Wangfujing Street?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不去逛逛王府井？

sentences.english: My date and I are just killing time right now.  We are just kind of hanging out.
sentences.chinese: 我和约会对象会在那里逛逛，消磨时间。

sentences.english: A strollthrough a couple of villages. Introductions to a few village elders.
sentences.chinese: 随便逛逛几个村子，和村中的族长简单聊聊。

sentences.english: I often enjoy poking around to see who is writing what from where.
sentences.chinese: 我经常上去逛逛，看看谁又在哪个地方写了些什么。

sentences.english: 00 pm - Walk along the wharf and shop in boutiques along the way.
Ellen:I think you can take them for a stroll around Wangfujing and Houhai.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得还可以带他们去王府井和后海逛逛。

sentences.english: I think I'd rather go shoe shopping before staring at the walls in some library.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我在去图书馆面壁之前还是先去逛逛鞋店吧。

sentences.english: Head to a website devoted to April Fool's Day.
sentences.chinese: 去一些愚人节专题网站逛逛。

sentences.english: I just like to hang out and have a good time with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 我只是喜欢到处逛逛，和朋友们一起开心地玩。

sentences.english: We shook the wriggle sway, hit off, but how also to its destination.
sentences.chinese: 我们摇扭捏晃，逛逛停停，却怎么也到不了终点。

sentences.english: I remember like loving to go there and just wander around and look at all the toys.
sentences.chinese: 我记得我很喜欢去那里逛逛，看那些玩具。

definition: to stroll/to go for a walk
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
(onom.) sound of muffled laughter (chuckling, tittering etc)/sound of stammering
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
